<strong>Ensuring proper administration o: Ensuring proper administration of our business which includes keeping appropriate records, resolving complaints and managing our business relationships and opportunities.
<strong>Location</strong> (up to country: Location (up to country level): We can identify the country you are located based on your IP address. Where we need to collect your precise location, we will request your consent.
<strong>Other Partners</strong>: We may: Other Partners: We may receive information about you, such as your contact details, from our partners who operate within the framework of surveys.
<strong>Performing service enhancement a: Performing service enhancement activities, which includes conducting statistical analysis on online activity, usage, browser, device and other data.
<strong>Preventing, detecting and fighti: Preventing, detecting and fighting fraud or other illegal or unauthorized activities which includes monitoring operations, user activity and networks for fraud prevention and crime detection purposes, including information from third parties who may monitor our website and systems and alert us about suspicious activities, auditing our systems and deploying security measures.
<strong>Sending marketing communications: Sending marketing communications about our services, products and our organisation.
<strong>Service Relationship</strong> wh: Service Relationship which includes providing our services, such as cash out, surveys, providing customer support and communicating with you about our services and products and about your engagement with us, such as changes in our terms.
<strong>To receive surveys</strong>: we: To receive surveys: we will collect your year and month of birth, your gender, your postcode, your marital status, education, employment and income range.

Cookie deployment - the survey partner m: Cookie deployment - the survey partner may occasionally ask to drop a cookie on your internet browser so that you can be invited to specific surveys based on your activity online.
For non-cookie derived information, we m: For non-cookie derived information, we may rely on our legitimate interests to improve your user experience and our services. These legitimate interests are pursued by us or our service providers acting on our behalf insofar as such interests do not pose a high risk to your rights and freedoms.
From time to time, our survey partners m: From time to time, our survey partners may run specific surveys that will collect personal data as part of the study. Before entering this data your should ensure the site has asked for your consent to collect and use this data with a clear description of what will be collected and how it will be used. Personal data should be retained only for such period as is appropriate for its intended and lawful use.
Full name, postal address, email and tel: Full name, postal address, email and telephone number - Surveys may ask for contact details in order to mail a physical product for review and feedback in a follow up survey; to perform additional identity verification checks; or to directly contact you for follow ups related to the survey.
If the personal information we hold abou: If the personal information we hold about you is incorrect, please let us know.
If you have any questions about how we c: If you have any questions about how we collect, store and use personal information, or if you have any other privacy-related questions, please e-mail us at <2>support@qmee.com</2>. You may also contact the Qmee Data Protection Office at <4>dpo@qmee.com</4>.
In case you decide to disclose any Speci: In case you decide to disclose any Special Category Data, we will process this data based on your consent. You can withdraw your consent for future usage at any time contacting us.
In certain circumstances, you may exerci: In certain circumstances, you may exercise the rights available to you under the applicable data protection legislation as follows:
Necessary for <strong>taking steps prior: Necessary for taking steps prior to entering into a contract with you.
Necessary for compliance with applicable: Necessary for compliance with applicable laws and regulations.
Necessary for our <strong>legitimate int: Necessary for our legitimate interest pursued by us or our service providers acting on our behalf or by a third-party insofar as such interests do not pose a high risk to your rights and freedoms.
Necessary for the <strong>performance of: Necessary for the performance of our contract with you.
Our legitimate interest is ensuring the: Our legitimate interest is ensuring the continuity of our service.
Our legitimate interest is making servic: Our legitimate interest is making services and features more relevant and improving user experience.
Our legitimate interest is preserving th: Our legitimate interest is preserving the security of our service.
Our legitimate interest is promoting our: Our legitimate interest is promoting our business and to provide you with offers of relevant services and products.

Qmee privacy notice which governs the co: Qmee privacy notice which governs the collection, storage and use of personal data collected by us.

Remember, you can choose to leave any su: Remember, you can choose to leave any survey that asks for personal data that you are not comfortable with providing.
Right of withdrawal consent at any time: Right of withdrawal consent at any time with effect for the future. In each of our email communications, we provide you with a corresponding link to manage your preferences or unsubscribe. You can also contact us by email.
Right to access personal information hel: Right to access personal information held about you and to ask for copies of your personal information.
Right to data portability. You can ask u: Right to data portability. You can ask us to transfer your personal information to you or to a third party you have chosen, your personal data in a structured, commonly used, machine- readable format. Please note that this right only applies in certain circumstances.
Right to lodge a complaint with a data p: Right to lodge a complaint with a data protection supervisory. The supervisory authority in the UK is the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) who may be contacted at https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/, however, we would appreciate the opportunity to handle your concerns before you approach the ICO, so we ask that you contact us first in this instance.
Right to object to and not be subject to: Right to object to and not be subject to a decision which is based solely on automated processing (including profiling) which may produce legal effects concerning you or could significantly affect you.
Right to object to processing your perso: Right to object to processing your personal information where the processing of your personal information is based on our legitimate interests. If we use your personal data for direct marketing, you can ask us to stop and we will comply with your request.
Right to request us to make any changes: Right to request us to make any changes and rectify your personal information if you think it is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask for information to be completed if you think it is incomplete.
Right to restriction of processing your: Right to restriction of processing your personal information in certain circumstances.
The lawful basis for processing your dat: The lawful basis for processing your data in these scenarios will be consent.
This Privacy Notice applies to this webs: This Privacy Notice applies to this website www.qmee.com, our qmee browser application software (which is available for download via the website) and our qmee mobile application. It provides you with details about the personal information we collect from you, how we use your personal information, our lawful bases for processing your data and your rights to control personal information we hold about you. Please read this Privacy Notice carefully.
This Privacy Notice governs the collecti: This Privacy Notice governs the collection, storage and use of personal information collected by usin providing our service.
This Privacy Notice was last updated in: This Privacy Notice was last updated in November 2021. Please check back regularly to keep informed of updates to this Privacy Notice.
This website contains links to other web: This website contains links to other websites operated by third parties. Please note that this privacy policy applies only to the personal information that we collect and we cannot be responsible for personal information that third parties may collect, store and use through their websites. Once you click on a link to a third party's website, including sponsored links provided in the Qmee window, that third party's collection, storage and use of your personal information is out of our control. You should always read the privacy policy of each website you visit carefully.
To <strong>establish, exercise or defend: To establish, exercise or defend legal claims in suspected or actual legal proceedings.
To <strong>exercise or perform any right: To exercise or perform any right or obligation which is conferred or imposed by law on us.
To earn that trust, we aim to be transpa: To earn that trust, we aim to be transparent and ensure you understand our privacy practices including the information we collect, why we collect it, how it is used and your choices regarding your personal information.
To exercise any of your rights set out a: To exercise any of your rights set out above, please contact us at <2>support@qmee.com</2>.
Videos of respondents - a video will be: Videos of respondents - a video will be collected during a webcam study of the respondent performing an activity, answering questions or watching a video. Videos may be reviewed manually by the survey client, or using automated technology like facial coding to gauge reactions.
We are the controller of your personal d: We are the controller of your personal data. We respect your right to privacy and will only process personal information you provide to us in accordance with the applicable privacy laws.
We do not sell, rent, or share personal: We do not sell, rent, or share personal information with third parties, nor do we sell, rent, or share personal information with third parties for their direct marketing purposes.
We implement security safeguards designe: We implement security safeguards designed to protect your data, such as HTTPS. We regularly monitor our systems for possible vulnerabilities and attacks.
We may also share information: (i) if di: We may also share information: (i) if disclosure would mitigate our liability in an actual or threatened lawsuit; (ii) as necessary to protect our legal rights and legal rights of our users, business partners or other interested parties; (iii) to enforce our agreements with you; and (iv) to investigate, prevent, or take other action regarding illegal activity, suspected fraud or other wrongdoing.
We may collect some demographic data whi: We may collect some demographic data which may be special category data which is more sensitive. We will ask you to explicitly consent before we store any such data. You may withdraw your consent at any time, and we will delete any special category data that we hold. You may control these settings on your profile page or request us to do so.
We may collect your <strong>consent</str: We may collect your consent for the use of analytics cookies and similar technologies to improve your user experience and our services. Please note you can withdraw your consent at any time contacting us.
We may disclose your personal informatio: We may disclose your personal information if reasonably necessary with regulators, law enforcement agencies or where mandatory under a court order: (i) to comply with a legal process, such as a court order, subpoena or search warrant, government / law enforcement investigation or other legal requirements; (ii) to assist in the prevention or detection of crime (subject in each case to applicable law); or (iii) to protect the safety of any person.
We may process your personal data for th: We may process your personal data for the purposes below and based on the following legal bases:
We may share your personal data with:: We may share your personal data with:
We may transfer your personal informatio: We may transfer your personal information if we are involved, whether in whole or in part, in a merger, sale, acquisition, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution, bankruptcy or other change of ownership or control.
We respond to all requests we receive fr: We respond to all requests we receive from users in accordance with applicable data protection laws. We may ask you to provide proof of identity before we can answer the above requests. In some cases, we may reject requests for certain reasons (for example, if the request is unlawful or if it may infringe on trade secrets or intellectual property or the privacy of another user).
We use cloud based services for processi: We use cloud based services for processing and storing your personal data. We currently use cloud based services based in the USA requiring an international transfer. When we send your personal information outside of your country, we have in place adequate safeguards to do so. This includes EU standard contract clauses approved by the European Commission or other suitable safeguard to permit personal information transfers from the United Kingdom and the European Economic Area to other countries.
We use third parties to help us operate: We use third parties to help us operate and improve our services and facilitate the fulfilment of essential service functions. These third parties assist us with various tasks, including personal information hosting and maintenance, with security tools and others.
We will include an unsubscribe link in a: We will include an unsubscribe link in all our email communications, which removes you from receiving further communications.
Webcam surveys are clearly identifiable: Webcam surveys are clearly identifiable and can be opted out of receiving, or taking part in, at any point.
Welcome to Qmee Limited (\"<strong>Qmee<: Welcome to Qmee Limited ("Qmee", "we", "our", "us"). We are committed to privacy compliance and to earning our users' ("you", "your") trust.
Where consent is not required, as you ar: Where consent is not required, as you are an existing customer who purchased or negotiated to purchase a similar service or product in the past, we may send you marketing communications based on our legitimate interest pursued by us or our service providers acting on our behalf or by a third-party insofar as such interests do not pose a high risk to your rights and freedoms.
Where we are <strong>legally required</s: Where we are legally required, we may process your personal data in connection to specific legislation, statutory codes of practice and other legal or tax related obligations.
Where you signed up for our newsletter o: Where you signed up for our newsletter or other content, we will send you relevant information based on your consent.
Whilst we can take every precaution to p: Whilst we can take every precaution to protect your personal information, it is important that you keep your passwords, account details and other user information secure and confidential.
You choose to give us certain informatio: You choose to give us certain information when using our services. This includes:
You may decide not to provide your perso: You may decide not to provide your personal information to us. However, in that case, please note that we may not be able to fully provide you with all our services.
You may request further information on t: You may request further information on the measures used for the international transfers.
Your personal information will be stored: Your personal information will be stored in accordance with applicable laws and kept for as long as needed to carry out the purposes described in this Privacy Notice or as otherwise required by applicable law. If you would like to find out more about how long we store your data for, please get in touch using the contact details above.
